Thanks! Let's merge! The plot family has 80% coverage right now, the `Tracker` class is holding it back with only 14%, but we can address this in future PRs:

https://codecov.io/bb/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/tree/f3900b933b63026bfa4586da406ffd832184d6a7/src/plugins/plot
content.html:

content.raw: Is this cross-platform?
content.html: Is this cross-platform?

content.raw: I suggest we remove the `Plot` prefix from classes which are already in the `plot` namespace. I'll go ahead and start with it, please stop me if you think it's a bad idea.
content.html: I suggest we remove the Plot prefix from classes which are already in the plot namespace. I'll go ahead and start with it, please stop me if you think it's a bad idea.

content.raw: Yeah this function is kinda weird, I wonder why we're not passing the label text to it. And whether it works if we call it twice for the same axis. No action needed now, but let's ticket an issue at least.
content.html: Yeah this function is kinda weird, I wonder why we're not passing the label text to it. And whether it works if we call it twice for the same axis. No action needed now, but let's ticket an issue at least.

update.description: A few more classes to integrate the plotting widget: `IncrementalPlot`, `PlotCurve` and `PlotTracker`.
update.title: Plot widget - part3

content.raw: Ah yes, you're correct, sorry for the mixup, the pills can't be dragged onto the canvas.
content.html: Ah yes, you're correct, sorry for the mixup, the pills can't be dragged onto the canvas.

content.raw: Thanks, I'll consider it for a future PR.
content.html: Thanks, I'll consider it for a future PR.

content.raw: This is caused by a check in `dragEnterEvent()`. In your example, the value of `_evt->mimeData()->hasFormat("application/x-item")` is false. That's why the drop is ignored. I'm guessing this is on purpose but I'm not super familiar with this part of the code. We could add `application/x-pill-item` if we want to support this feature but I believe in Gazebo you cannot drag the existing pill inside the plot again.
content.html: This is caused by a check in dragEnterEvent(). In your example, the value of _evt->mimeData()->hasFormat("application/x-item") is false. That's why the drop is ignored. I'm guessing this is on purpose but I'm not super familiar with this part of the code. We could add application/x-pill-item if we want to support this feature but I believe in Gazebo you cannot drag the existing pill inside the plot again.

I think that since we're not supporting qt4, we only need to support qwt >= 6.1.0:

https://sourceforge.net/p/qwt/news/
